meanings.definition: In a literal or strict sense, without exaggeration or metaphor.
meanings.sent1: She literally ran to the store as fast as she could.
meanings.sent2: I literally have a million things to do today.
meanings.sent3: He literally jumped for joy when he heard the good news.
meanings.sent4: The idea literally sparked a fire in her imagination.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset were literally painting the sky.

meanings.definition: Used to emphasize the truth of a statement.
meanings.sent1: I literally cannot believe how fast time flies.
meanings.sent2: She literally told me the same story three times.
meanings.sent3: The cat literally thinks it's the king of the house.
meanings.sent4: His smile literally lights up the room.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room was literally palpable.

meanings.definition: Used to acknowledge that something is true in a literal sense.
meanings.sent1: I literally saw a shooting star last night.
meanings.sent2: She literally ate the entire cake by herself.
meanings.sent3: The dog literally thinks the mailman is a threat.
meanings.sent4: His words literally cut through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the air was literally suffocating.
